intro: Echioides alpestris, commonly known as the alpine echium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echioides alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes where few other plants can survive.
